docs.lead_paragraph: Deregulation Is Passed For Telecommunications Congress voted overwhelmingly to deregulate the nation's communications laws, passing, after four years of struggle and gridlock, a bill that will transform television, telephones and the emerging frontiers of computer networks.

docs.lead_paragraph: IT'S 1998. You're dead. What do you do now?" Life insurers across the country, who are about to introduce a tough campaign extolling the benefits of death, are hoping the question will not leave consumers cold.

headline.main: The life insurance industry unleashes a tough-talk campaign on the advantages of planning ahead.

docs.snippet: IT'S 1998. You're dead. What do you do now?"         Life insurers across the country, who are about to introduce a tough campaign extolling the benefits of death, are hoping the question will not leave consumers cold.

keywords.value: LIFE & HEALTH INSURANCE FOUNDATION FOR EDUCATION

docs.lead_paragraph: Fed Lowers Interest Rates To Nudge a Weak Economy The Federal Reserve lowered short-term interest rates by one-quarter percentage point to give the economy a modest spark. In its second rate cut in six weeks, the central bank lowered the Federal Funds rate at which banks lend each other money overnight to 5.25 percent and the discount rate, at which it lends banks money, to 5 percent.
